reviews.text: The staff was warm and welcoming upon our arrival. Our second floor room was immaculate and had a nice size balcony which overlooked the indoor pool area. Stairs near our room led directly down to the pool area, which had a game area. There was both an indoor and an outdoor jacuzzi with views of a landscaped pond. Even though our room was off the pool, it was extremely quiet. The beds were extremely comfortable. The location was conveniently located near main attractions. The staff was very helpful in recommending several restaurants and giving us directions to the beach. The complimentary breakfast was quite extensive and good. The free wi-fi was fast. Overall this was a very pleasant experience and we will definitely stay there again as a family.
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can echo the majority when I say this is a fabulous place to stay when you're in Holland. Cleanliness is very important to me, and I have never been in a cleaner hotel in my life! A nice touch is that on the bed is a duvet that they launder after every guest. so no worries about a dirty bedspread that someone else has used. The room and furnishings looked new - beautiful tile floors in the entry and bathroom, granite countertop, large 4-drawer chest of drawers in the bedroom area and 2 night stands with 2 more large drawers. All the doors were 6-panel, including the closet. A comfortable chair and ottoman were also in the room, along with a desk and office chair. A refrigerator and microwave were also in the room, along with a coffee pot and supplies.
reviews.title: Comfortable rooms and EXCELLENT customer service!

reviews.text: My husband used the indoor hot tub (they also have one outside) and he said it was the cleanest one he'd every been in. The pool area is quite large with lots of seating on 2 levels overlooking it. The area around the pool also has a pool table, foosball, and air hockey table. Great for a weekend away with the kids!
reviews.title: Our Favorite in Holland

reviews.text: The free breakfast was incredible. The day we were there they had make your own waffles, french toast, eggs (scrambled and hard boiled), sausage patties, toast, bagels and cream cheese, danishes, several kinds of cereals, 2% and skim milk, apples, bananas, oranges, and yogurt. More than enough food for a hearty breakfast!
reviews.title: A wonderful place to stay in Holland!

reviews.text: You can't go wrong if you stay here.
reviews.title: As we expected

reviews.text: We were in Holland to help a family member move, so were tired and hot upon arrival. Our room was excellent, very spacious, with a generous bathroom. Large shower with no tub, which was perfect for my husband, who has some disability issues. As tall folks, we appreciated the higher counter in the bathroom. Our only issue with the room was the loudness of the fan, which we were using as white noise, as the hotel was full of families in town for a youth baseball tourney. There was no low fan setting, so the roar was a bit much. Also, the king bed had a queen top sheet. Hampton's very lumpy duvets need to be replaced soon! We often take out the inner comforter and just use the cotton cover. We were next to the guest laundry (which is very handy) but we could hear the machines through the adjoining wall at times.
reviews.title: Great room, restaurant, not so much!

reviews.text: The restaurant is really more pub style with ordering at the bar. Very noisy and dark. Food that we ordered to take to our room took far too long even though Sharkey's wasn't that busy. Food was very good, once it arrived. Breakfast in the same area flowed more smoothly than we anticipated; it just isn't a great space.
reviews.title: Very Updated!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, our stay was good, and we would probably stay there again.
reviews.title: some very nice surprises

reviews.text: My husband, 1 year old daughter and I stayed over the 4th of July weekend, while the room was a little pricey, we were very pleased with our room, the updated look of the hotel and the ammenities. The breakfast was very good and changed and had a variety of hot and cold foods both mornings we were there. I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Perfect for business

reviews.text: The remodel was very nice. We liked having a bar and restaurant handy, especially at 10:30 on a sunday night. The pasta dish and salad were a delicious surprise. Most impressive though were the food and staff at breakfast on the morning. When we were there it was very busy and the staff kept up admirably. The food was a step above most other hotel breakfasts, including some Hampton Inns. The scrambled eggs were way more that the dry, rubber eggs one usually gets. We would stay there again and reccomend it to out friends.
reviews.title: A home away from home, but that restaurant needs some help....

reviews.text: I do like Hampton Inns and so I chose it again for a one night stay in Holland. We booked 2 rooms for us and our son and daughter-in-law and got connecting rooms. Check-in was smooth and I liked it a lot. I don't know which exterior was gaudier-the pink Hampton or the crazy patterned Holiday Inn next door. Must be the thing in Holland which can be a bit hokey. We were here "off-season" No tulips. Breakfast at this Hampton would have benefitted from some cut fruit. That is my only complaint.
reviews.title: Everything I expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the second time staying at this great Hampton Inn located in Holland, MI. We have stayed in many Hampton Inns and this one is by far the best. There is an onsite restaurant/bar, as well as a game room, a huge pool and two hot tubs. Not to mention the comfy Hampton Bed!! We are planning on staying here again soon!
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Annually, we visit Michigan. We stay in Holland but in addition to downtown Holland, we spend time in Saugatuck and visit friends in South Haven. The reason we stay in Holland is because of the hotel and the fact that it has a restaurant/bar which up to this visit we always enjoyed. There were usually business travelers and locals who frequented the bar. After a busy day shopping, we would go down to Sharkees for a glass of wine before retiring. This trip there were few people in the bar. They have a "Happy Hour" from 4-7 PM. During this time, a 16 ounce beer is $2 and a mixed drink is $2.50. Time and time again, patrons would come to the bar and ask for a beer. The bartender would ask if they wanted a 16 or 20 oz glass but never mentioned that the 16 ounce was $2 and the 20 ounce was $4.50. No signage at the bar - only at the tables. In addition, the young bartending staffs drinking friends took over the bar and discussed how drunk they got last night and how many times they threw up. Not a nice top for a restaurant/bar. We will not go back. It is expensive for a Hampton and they seem to have little control over Sharkees.
reviews.title: The hotel is great but stay out of the restaurant/bar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived early via Motorcycle and were hoping to get in to the room early. They did make us wait until the official check in time but upon check in the room was very clean, neat, fresh and comfortable. We booked a jacuzzi room which was nicely decorated and spacious for 2 people. The bed was firm but comfortable. We walked to a nearby restaurant for dinner just a few blocks away - there were decent dining options to choose from. The hot breakfast is nice although not many "Hot" options besides biscuits & gravy, eggs, and waffles. Very sufficient for our needs. We are somewhat picky in terms of hotels and I can't find any faults with this hotel - would recommend although I haven't been to any other hotels in Holland.
reviews.title: Remodeled and very nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent two nights here while visiting Holland for a short vacation. The hotel seemed newly remodeled, and the rooms were well-furnished. The bed was especially comfortable, and the room and bathroom were spacious. Breakfast was included as a standard Hampton amenity, and there was a variety of hot and cold options. The game room and pool area were very busy, so we didn't get a chance to enjoy that particular feature.
reviews.title: near attractions in Holland but very busy

reviews.text: I have written over 125 reviews. Most hotels don't bother vacuming on guest check out. Service is un-enthusiastic. Breakfast is a few cheap items. Etc. I was rained out of a camping trip and diverted to the Hampton Inn Holland.
First, this is bigger than an average Hampton.
reviews.title: A++ Hotel!!!

reviews.text: Rooms have small refrigerator.
reviews.title: Super nice place

reviews.text: Coffee maker is a 4+ cup coffee maker--not the stingy one cup coffee makers most hotels have gone too--including most Hilton and Marriott brands.
reviews.title: What a great surprise.

reviews.text: Hotel restaurant had great pizza.
reviews.title: We'll return again!
